conclusion: Identify the critical angle as gamma.
Understand the geometry: semicircular glass brick with radius R, light strikes at angle pi - gamma.
At point E, angle of incidence is pi/2 and OE = R.
Light rays entering at angles less than gamma pass through directly; point M is tangent point.
Calculate OM using right triangle: OM = R cos(gamma).
Calculate width MN = R + OM = R + R cos(gamma).
Final answer: Width of the portion of the base through which light passes is R(1 + cos(gamma)).
